page.title: 10HOUSING, DEEPCAR AND WORTLEY
page.content: {DEEPCAR}There are 3 phases of development:nodal around Vaughton Hill (1855 O.S.), linear along Manchester Rd.(1929 O.S.) and residential estates on the hillside S. of Carr Rd. from 1960s. In 1851 there were 7 houses. In the next 50 yrs. were built St. John's church(1878), schools (Jun.1856, Inf. 1896) and police station (1890) to accompany industrial devt.{Victorian houses and earlier mostly built from {local stone}(Inf.Sch. and police stn. brick) as are the nearby farms. The {estates}were built on former farmland changing the village into a dormitory {suburb}for commuters; most detached, semis or low-level flats.'Green Belt' restricts further building for at least 10 yrs. Devt. on S. side of the valley to avoid smoke from industry. Many farms and smallholdings near {WORTLEY}are 17th. Century.
